entry.title: Putin Turned to a Chechen Warlord to Intimidate Ukraine. It Hasn't Worked.
entry.content: President Vladimir Putin has turned again and again to Ramzan Kadyrov’s forces from Chechnya, reveling in the Chechens’ fearsome reputation.

entry.title: Survivors Rescued From Ukraine Theater Hit by Russian Airstrike
entry.content: Workers evacuated 130 people from the wreckage of a theater in Mariupol following a Russian airstrike on the southern port city, Ukraine’s ombudsman said. About 1,300 remained trapped in the basement of the theater.

entry.title: Clandestine Finance System Helped Iran Withstand Sanctions Crush, Documents Show
entry.content: The system has helped Tehran resist the Biden administration’s pressure to rejoin the 2015 nuclear deal, buying it time to advance its nuclear program even while negotiations were under way.

entry.title: Ukrainian Counteroffensive Relieves Strategic Port City
entry.content: For weeks, Mykolaiv was on the front line. Now, with Ukrainian forces pressing a counteroffensive, the Russians have been pushed back and the port city’s 470,000 people are attempting a tentative return to normality.
